meanings.definition: Responsibility for a mistake or wrongdoing
meanings.sent1: It was my fault for forgetting to do my homework.
meanings.sent2: She accepted fault for the error in the report.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocking over the vase was entirely its fault.
meanings.sent4: The fault lies with the driver who ran the red light.
meanings.sent5: Taking responsibility for your actions shows maturity and character.

meanings.sent1: The fault in the mirror distorted my reflection.
meanings.sent2: The fault in the design caused the machine to malfunction.
meanings.sent3: The fault in the plan became evident during the presentation.
meanings.sent4: Her perfectionism made her blind to any fault in her work.
meanings.sent5: The fault in the diamond made it less valuable to collectors.

meanings.sent1: He placed the fault on his coworker for the project delay.
meanings.sent2: The fault for the mistake was quickly assigned to the new employee.
meanings.sent3: The fault for the burnt cookies was jokingly blamed on the oven.
meanings.sent4: She couldn't handle the fault directed at her for the team's loss.
meanings.sent5: Constructive feedback aims to improve without placing fault on individuals.

meanings.definition: A fracture in the Earth's crust
meanings.sent1: The geologist studied the fault line for signs of movement.
meanings.sent2: Living near a fault can be risky due to potential earthquakes.
meanings.sent3: The fault in the Earth's crust caused the ground to shift.
meanings.sent4: The fault created by tectonic plates colliding can be massive.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the fault in the Earth's crust helps understand geological processes.
